title: THE CASE OF THE DEFINITELY DEAD PRESIDENT
description: Deductive Logico went to the president's office and said, "I'm here to meet with the president." Unfortunately, they said, "The president's dead." But nobody had left the room. So instead of meeting with the president, he worked to solve his murder.

suspects.name: NUMEROLOGIST NIGHT
suspects.description: A mathematical and esoteric prodigy. Not only do they know the value of Z, they know the meaning of Z.

suspects.name: HERBALIST ONYX
suspects.description: In her greenhouse, she's grown every kind of plant required in the culinary, magick, and poisoning arts.

suspects.name: HIGH ALCHEMIST RAVEN
suspects.description: There's an old joke that all alchemists are high alchemists. Raven hates it.

weapons.name: A HYPNOTIC POCKET WATCH
weapons.description: If you look deeply into this watch, you can tell the time.

weapons.name: A DECK OF MAROT CARDS
weapons.description: You can use these murder-themed tarot cards to tell your fortune.

weapons.name: A PSEUDO-SCIENTIFIC APPARATUS
weapons.description: It measures quantonic currents to evaluate your inner blaxons.

locations.name: THE BOOK LADDER
locations.description: Climb up and grab a book, or just slide around the room yelling, "Wahoo!"

locations.name: THE COUCH
locations.description: A faux-leather couch, great for dozing off in the middle of the day.

locations.name: THE DESK
locations.description: Topped with lots of important paperwork and a computer from the eighties.

clues: The suspect with the pseudo-scientific apparatus was born on September 7. (See Exhibit B.)
A careful search revealed a fortune-telling card wedged between two faux-leather seat cushions.
